newsitem.title: USA: ADM takes stake in Minnesota corn operation.
newsitem.headline: ADM takes stake in Minnesota corn operation.

text.p: Minnesota Corn Processors, a corn wet milling operation based here, said Friday it signed a letter of intent with Archer Daniels Midland Co, allowing ADM to acquire a passive investment position in it.
ADM, the Decatur, Ill.-based agribusiness giant, confirmed the investment, but did not disclose the dollar amount.
Minnesota Corn Processors, which has plants in Marshall and Columbus, Neb., said the transaction is expected to be completed on or about July 31.
It is subject to customary closing conditions and the approval of Minnesota Corn Processors' grower members and ADM's board.
Minnesota Corn Processors said the agreement will allow it to remain an independent, grower-owned cooperative with complete control of its operations and sales and marketing functions.
It said the investment is expected to provide funds necessary for Minnesota Corn Processors to restructure its capital position and re-establish its long-term financial stability.
